hackathon-description-text: Come Celebrate New Haven’s vibrant and growing tech scene with our first city hackathon! Join students, hobbyists and professionals as we meet new people, play with new tech, and build cool projects.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director, Parking & Traffic, City of New Haven

hackathon-requirements: Submissions will be presented in person on the afternoon of 10/18.
hackathon-rules:
Rules:
All projects must be original
Team members must be present during Saturday morning setup and Sunday afternoon presentation
No remote submissions are allowed
 
Code of Conduct:
We have a zero-tolerance policy for harassment of any kind. This is a community event and all members are equally welcome and to be respected at all times. This includes disparaging comments, sexualized language, imagery, jokes, stories, references, and other communications of a sexual, racial, gender, age nature.
We support divesity and inclusion. This includes those who are earlier on their learning journey, from an age, experience, or ability standpoint. It is crucial for the growth of our community that those of greater ability support and mentor those still learning.
Any disparaging comments, imagery, stories, jokes or other communications will be met with immediate explusion.
Please contact the organizers directly or via anonymous email with any questions or concerns.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=50 Union Ave, New Haven, CT 06519, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How hard was the project you attempted?
How well did the project work?

How well presented is the idea?
How well does it work for users?

hackathon-location-address: 50 Union Ave, New Haven, CT 06519, USA
